I can suggest some tips that may help improve sleep:

1. stick to a regular sleep schedule: try to go to bed and wake up at the same time every day, even on weekends. it helps regulate your body's sleep-wake cycle. 2. create a bedtime routine: developing a bedtime routine like taking a warm bath, reading a book, or listening to soothing music can signal your body to prepare for sleep. 3. make your bedroom sleep-friendly: make sure your bedroom is cool, dark, and quiet. use curtains or blinds to block out any light, and use earplugs or a white noise machine to block out any noise. 4. avoid stimulating activities before bedtime: avoid activities that may cause stress, anxiety, or excitement before bedtime, such as watching tv, using electronic devices, or working. 5. limit caffeine and alcohol: caffeine and alcohol can interfere with sleep, so it's important to limit your intake before bedtime. 6. get regular exercise: exercise during the day can help you sleep better at night. however, avoid exercising too close to bedtime as it can interfere with your sleep. note: if you continue to struggle with sleep, consider speaking with your doctor as there may be underlying medical conditions that need to be addressed.
